title: Public Justice Hearings
outcome: Citizen juries are established in several neighborhoods to publicly review both local records and the Council's recent actions. The most anticipated hearing targets a former Council official over BCI-related denials and Halden’s death cover-up. Livestreamed deliberations expose contradictory testimonies and ignite a surge of leaked evidence. As protests grow, Council factions leak even older secrets to manipulate outcomes, inadvertently eroding their own legitimacy. Citizens experience a sense of justice but divisions are stoked citywide.

events.description: Neighborhoods announce formation of livestreamed citizen juries to review local BCI records and scrutinize Council decisions.
The first high-profile jury calls a Council official to answer for service denials linked to BCI data and the secrecy surrounding Halden’s death.
Testimonies and evidence leaks fuel large protests, as contradictions emerge between public statements and internal Council documents.
Council factions, desperate to sway opinions, leak older secrets and blame one another for BCI failures and disappearances.
Sense of public empowerment grows, but deepening divisions and widespread distrust linger as the true complexity of system abuses comes to light.
